news.title: Ethereum turns 10: From scrappy experiment to Wall Street’s invisible backbone
news.summary: Once dismissed as a side project to bitcoin, the blockchain now powers stablecoins, tokenized assets, and the payment rails of major banks.

news.title: Figma CEO's path from college dropout and Thiel fellow to tech billionaire
news.summary: Figma's CEO owns a stake worth about $6.6 billion. After Figma's first two days of trading on the NYSE, 33-year-old CEO Dylan Field owns about $5 billion.

news.title: Berkshire Hathaway operating earnings dip 4% as conglomerate braces for tariff impact
news.summary: Berkshire's operating profit dipped 4% year over year to $11.16 billion in the second quarter. The company's net income was $2.2 billion, down from $3.1 billion a year earlier.

news.title: The AI 'algorithmic audit' could be coming to hotel room checkout
news.summary: AI is already influencing bills at the car rental counter. Your hotel room charges and dinner check could be next. It could also be used to determine how much you pay for utilities.

news.title: Top Wall Street analysts pick these 3 stocks for their growth potential
news.summary: TipRanks' analyst ranking service discusses three stocks, including MongoDB and ServiceNow. TipRanks: MongoDB, ServiceNow, favored by Wall Street.

news.title: ‘The sky has not fallen — yet’: Is it time to start worrying about a U.S. recession?
news.summary: The economy added just 73,000 new jobs in July. GDP rose by 3% in the second quarter, but the economy added only 73,00 new jobs.

news.title: ‘I have never been asked for money before’: My friend wants to borrow $1,600 to pay her rent. Do I say yes?
news.summary: “I have heard mixed reviews on lending people money,” he says. “I’m not sure what the future holds for me.”

news.title: Will my spouse automatically inherit my 401(k)?
news.summary: "What happens if the participant gets married again, but doesn’t update the beneficiary to be their new spouse? “ asks the lawyer. “What happens If the participant Gets Married Again, but Doesn't Update the Beneficiary to be Their New spouse?"

news.title: ‘I worked at 14, had an 8.8% mortgage rate and drove used cars’: Did boomers really have it easier than millennials?
news.summary: ‘We were frugal, using coupons, discount stores, shopping during the sales and eating leftovers,’ one baby-boomer reader writes.

news.title: A court could strike down Trump’s tariffs—and blow a hole in the U.S. budget
news.summary: Trump administration lawyers are trying to save ‘liberation day’ tariffs. They risk losing billions in government revenue if they don’t.
